title: Introduction to RRP
discription: This is video is an introduction to RRP application process for yourself and your company. Learn what target housing is. Learn RRP project posting requirements. Understand how project posting records must be timely, complete and available for 3 years.

title: Firm and Certified Renovators
discription: There are two types of RRP certifications; Certified Renovator and Firm Certification. Both license are required before you start a RRP project. Learn what's required to successfully complete the forms.

title: Lead based Paint inspection
discription: Discovering where lead based paint exists and the acceptable methods used to test for their presence.

title: Pre-renovation Education
discription: Demonstrates how to deliver Renovation Right pamphlets and how to prove you have complied with RRP notice requirements.

title: Before starting work
discription: Learn about LLNAP testing of scraped paint and chemical test kits. The hand held XRAF device above uses a gamma ray spectrometer to detect the percent of lead in each layer of paint. For all types of testing a plan is required to adequately locate sample location, condition, material type and sample method used for future reference.

title: Lead Safe Work Practices
discription: Successful RRP implementation is explained in 7 basic steps which guide users through RRP projects from the beginning to the end.

title: Interior Setup
discription: Learn hoe to limit access and control the spread of lead dust generated by project activities.

title: Exterior setup
discription: Learn how to establish work areas and learn minimum protection requirements. Understand how to spot where  additional containments are required for safety of workers and the public.

title: Cleaning, Inspection and Verification
discription: Post Renovation reporting is a summary of RRP project activities. The report should be signed by the Certified Renovator and property owner for proof you successfully completed the designated RRP work areas within the project. Retain this record and all reports audited by any governmental body or courts, these document establish your compliance.

title: Visual Inspection
discription: Only a Certified Renovators conducts visual inspections. Learn what's required. Only Certified Renovators can conduct visual inspections. Learn about testing and then needing to retest.

title: Cleaning
discription: Demonstrates effective cleaning techniques for RRP work areas. Learn projects work methods and suggestions for successful implementation for obtaining cleaning clearance.

title: Waste Containment and disposal
discription: Learn how to handle and dispose of lead wast for RRP work. It's the contractors responsibility to be aware of any state or local ordinances governing how to dispose of lead waste products.

title: Post renovation report
discription: Post Renovation report. Only the Certified Renovator assigned to the project may sign the Post Renovation report. The report additionally has a place for the owner(s) to sign at the bottom.
